title: Analysis of E-Learning Technology Acceptance Factors: A Case Study of FROG VLE

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device proficiency and comprehension of educational technology
context.additional_context: A course analyzing smartphone-optimized e-learning technology adoption factors for pre-service and in-service teachers. Based on smartphone-centric learning activities in PC-unavailable environments.

learning_goals: The factors influencing e-learning technology acceptance can be analyzed by applying a mixed-methods research approach (quantitative/qualitative).
The seven core factors (usability, ease of use, self-efficacy, etc.) derived from the FROG VLE case can be connected to actual educational contexts.
Factors influencing acceptance can be identified when designing mobile microlearning in limited technological environments.

resources: Voice Recording App for Quick Interviews
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
